title: [Large-scale] Problem-Based Learning (PBL) Design for Software Modeling

context.prior_knowledge: Basic programming language comprehension and foundational knowledge of the software development lifecycle
context.additional_context: Learners participate in the course to improve their practical application of software modeling for employment readiness. Digital devices (tablets/laptops) are provided, with hands-on practice using UML diagramming tools (e.g., Lucidchart) and version control systems (Git).

learning_goals: Learners can write UML class diagrams and sequence diagrams according to a given business scenario to clearly express system requirements.
Learners can collaboratively solve software design problems through PBL team activities (3-4 members) and present results via pitching sessions.
Learners can analyze modeling error cases (e.g., missing dependencies, excessive coupling) from actual industry settings and suggest improvements in summative assessments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
